content.description: Start by climbing up some strange wavy rock features that provide good pinches or sidepulls. The first bolt is about 15 feet up or so but the climbing is easy. Gain a ledge and now the real climbing begins. Two more bolts get you to the crux which you'll have to commit to before being able to clip the final bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: The tall faceÂ just to the right when walking through the north pass.

content.description: Mini route that climbs well. Pretty juggy with no real crux, but nicely steep for it's length.
content.location: Short route on your right, immediately after passing through the notch/North Pass.

content.description:
Follow three bolts of 5.10 on the lower section, using good edges and a slopey arete. From the break with the overhanging upper block, move right to match a gaston/pocket, right again to a large sloping edge, then make a left-hand throw to a shallow pocket. A final, sinker pocket awaits just below the anchors.

Some may be tempted to continue up the left arete from the break on the upper block, which is heinously crumbly, was not cleaned at all, and is not recommended.
content.location: First route on the right when coming through the North Pass. Look for an arete to overhanging face.
